name: paw
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 [ C ] the foot of an animal that has claws or nails, such as a cat, dog, or bear: I found paw prints in the kitchen. Compare
hoof noun
Suthep Wongkhad/EyeEm/GettyImages
[ C usually plural ] informal humorous a human hand: Take your filthy paws off my nice clean towel!
More examplesFewer examplesThe dog hurt its paw.She gave a little whimper as the vet inspected her paw.He keeps a rabbit's paw as a lucky charm.Lost: black cat with white paws.His front paws are white.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
The hand
[ I or T ] to touch something with a paw: When their dog heard them it began pawing (at) the ground in excitement.
[ T ] informal to feel or touch someone roughly with the hands, especially in an unpleasant sexual way

the foot of an animal, such as a cat, dog, or bear, that has claws or nails
infml A person who paws someone else feels or touches the other person, often in a sexual way that is too forceful.
